text_126.en: In mobile UI design, a Chip is a compact element displaying attributes, input, or actions. Material Design defines it with rounded corners and a contained style. Chips offer a visual representation for categories, selections, or interactions, contributing to a clear and concise user interface in mobile applications.

text_128.en: Add a chip into your app using the `addChip` method like this:

text_136.en: If you want to change the height of the Chip later on after initializing, pass the `height` argument.

text_138.en: Here are the available setters and/or getters of the Chip Component.

text_190.en: Here are the methods available for Chips Component

text_192.en: Adds a callback handler when the chip is touch.

text_196.en: Sets the chip to clickable. This will add a pointer cursor into the chip when hovered.

text_200.en: Sets a callback function when the chip is deleted. This will automatically add a delete icon to the chip.

text_204.en: Sets the corner radius of the chip.

text_32.en: Adds a callback function on right click.

text_41.en: Sets the size of the component.

text_58.en: Sets the x and y scaling of the component.

text_63.en: Returns the position of the component. The return object is of the form `{left, top, right, bottom}`

text_68.en: Sets the margin of the component.

text_76.en: Sets the padding of the component's container.

text_84.en: Sets the position of the component relative to its parent dimensions.

text_90.en: Sets the border line for the component container.

text_99.en: Sets the corner radius of the component.

text_107.en: Bring this component forward by a given z-index.

text_111.en: Bring this component backward by a given z-index.
